event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of correctable errors associated with a FLP chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The number of correctable errors associated with a FLP chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.


    SPARC Enterprise M3000 platforms:

       Platform will become unbootable, since the platform has a single FLP chip.



    SPARC Enterprise M4000 platforms:

       Dynamic Reconfiguration operations should be performed to remove the affected FRU from service.

       The IO Channel associated with the faulty FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled,
       after the domain reboots, or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

    Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.
   
       IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
       and all the internal I/O.

       IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.



    SPARC Enterprise M5000 platforms:

       Dynamic Reconfiguration operations should be performed to remove the affected FRU from service.

       The IO Channel associated with the faulty FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled,
       after the domain reboots, or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

    Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.

       IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
       and all the internal I/O.

          IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
          IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.

       IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.



    SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:

       Dynamic Reconfiguration operations should be performed to remove the affected FRU from service.

       The IO Channel associated with the faulty FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled,
       after the domain reboots, or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

    Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.
   
       IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 0 and 1 on this IOU.

       IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 2 and 3 on this IOU.

       IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 4 and 5 on this IOU.

       IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 6 and 7 on this IOU.




The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:05:23 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: a6c379f3-9380-4ff9-b08f-41fd44535149
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-AA for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-AA, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:05:22 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: a6c379f3-9380-4ff9-b08f-41fd44535149
   DESC: The number of correctable errors associated with a FLP chip has exceeded an
   acceptable threshold.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-AA for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The IO Channel associated with the FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power
   cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   IMPACT: No immediate impact. The IO Channel associated with the FLP chip will be deconfigured after the
   platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is
   performed.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.



Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u a6c379f3-9380-4ff9-b08f-41fd44535149

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:05:22.9780 a6c379f3-9380-4ff9-b08f-41fd44535149 SCF-8001-AA
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.flp.ce

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate impact. The IO Channel associated with the FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The IO Channel associated with the FLP chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Correctable errors for a FLP chip exceeded an acceptable threshold.
